citation.article-title: Gracilimonas tropica gen. nov., sp. nov., isolated from a Synechococcus culture.
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Description of Gracilimonas tropica sp. nov.
Gracilimonas tropica [tro′pi.ca. L. fem. adj. tropica tropical, of or pertaining to the tropic(s), relating to its isolation from a tropical ocean].
Exhibits the following properties in addition to those given in the genus description.
Cells are long and thin rods, approximately 0.2–0.3 μm wide and 6.5–17.7 μm long.
On MA, colonies are circular, entire, convex, opaque and orange.
Grows within the temperature range of 20–40 °C (optimum 35 °C), at pH 6–10 and at sea salt concentrations of 1–20 % (w/v).
No growth without sea salts in the medium.
Hydrolyses starch, gelatin and Tweens 40 and 80.

According to API 20NE tests, positive for gelatinase activity but negative for nitrate reductase, arginine dihydrolase and urease activities, indole production, acid production from glucose and aesculin hydrolysis.
Acid is produced from glucose in ZOF medium.

According to API ZYM tests, alkaline phosphatase, esterase (C4), esterase lipase (C8), weak lipase (C14), leucine arylamidase, valine arylamidase, cystine arylamidase, α-chymotrypsin, acid phosphatase, naphthol-AS-BI-phosphohydrolase and N-acetyl-β-glucosaminidase activities are present, whereas α-galactosidase, β-galactosidase, β-glucuronidase, α-glucosidase, β-glucosidase, α-mannosidase and α-fucosidase activities are absent.
Growth occurs on fructose, glucose and aspartate but not on acetate, citrate, galactose, mannitol, inositol, lactose, succinate or sucrose.
The type strain, CL-CB462T (=KCCM 90063T =DSM 19535T), was isolated from a Synechococcus culture established from surface water of the tropical Pacific Ocean.
The DNA G+C content of the type strain is 42.7 mol%.
